titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, Peace and Social Justice Division (PSJ), Governance and Civil Society, Senior Program Officer, Office Files of Michael Lipsky
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, Peace and Social Justice Division (PSJ), Governance and Civil Society, Senior Program Officer, Office Files of Michael Lipsky FA595

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-11-22 01:05:30 -0500.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, Peace and Social Justice Division (PSJ), Governance and Civil Society, Senior Program Officer, Office Files of Michael Lipsky

physdesc.extent: 6 record storage boxes, 1 legal document box

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: Ford Foundation holds title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them. The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection for scholarly purposes. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Ford Foundation.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Ford Foundation archive was deposited at RAC in 2011. Ford Foundation records, correspondence, reports, program files and officers papers were transferred to, and accessioned by, RAC beginning in 2011. Accessions continue as necessary.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Level 1 Minimal Processing has been conducted to establish basic intellectual and physical control of the material and assess immediate preservation and conservation needs. Material remains as received, in original folders and storage boxes.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Records more than 10 years old are open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.
Completion of a use agreement is required prior to providing scholarly access. See RAC Head of Reference (or applicable designee) for details.

Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in 4 series by file type.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence, program files, innovations in and state and local government files, program-related investments and finance related files.
